required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: ProSA is a prospective, non-randomized, multicenter, observational study investigating the utilization and effectiveness of the Smart Shock™ algorithm in ICD patients treated with a Protecta™, Protecta™ XT or any equivalent following product.

primary_outcome.measure: Analysis of Change of Episodes Inappropriately Treated by Shock Therapy Due to Smart Shock™ Technology.
primary_outcome.description: Smart Shock technology is a suite of algorithms that are designed to prevent inappropriate shocks in ICD&CRT patients. Endpoints for the primary objective: Episodes with shock therapy Episodes without shock delivery due to Smart Shock™ technology Episodes classified as supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) by PR Logic Episodes classified as SVT by Wavelet Shock therapy suppressed by T-wave Discrimination Shock therapy suppressed by Lead Noise Discrimination Shock therapy suppressed by Confirmation + Episode with successful anti-tachycardia pacing (ATP) During Charging

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With All Smart Shock Algorithms Are Programmed on
secondary_outcome.description: Endpoint: Patients, in which none of the Smart Shock algorithms is programmed "OFF" during the first Follow-Up after a maximum length of 90 days and 180 days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients, Without Shock Delivery Due to Smart Shock Technology
secondary_outcome.description: Endpoint: Patients without shock delivery due to Smart Shock technology

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of the Number of Patients With Primary Preventive Indication for an ICD That Develop VF Episodes.
secondary_outcome.description: Endpoint: Number of primary prevention patients with at least one ventricular fibrillation (VF) episode detected and successfully treated by the ICD

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients That Developed AT/AF
secondary_outcome.description: Endpoint: patients with >5 min atrial tachycardia/atrial fibrillation (AT/AF) in 'Daily Log' (Cardiac Compass)

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of the Proportion of Patients in Which ICD Parameters Remain on Nominal Programming.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the first Follow-Up ≥ 90 days post-implant
secondary_outcome.description: Endpoint: Deviation of ICD parameter programming in comparison to nominal programming at the first Follow-Up ≥ 90 days post-implant. Nominals for dual chamber ICD or cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) devices: Lead Noise Discrimination = 'OnWithTimeout' Lead Failure Predictor = 'On' PR-Logic: AfibAflutter Rejection Rule = 'On' PR-Logic: Sinus Tach Rejection Rule = 'On' PR-Logic: Other 1:1 Rejection Rule = 'On' High Rate Timeout = 'Off' VF High Rate Timeout = 'Off' Wavelet Rejection Rule = 'On' VF Detection Interval = 320 and SVT Minimum Cycle Length = 260 T-Wave Oversensing Discrimination = 'On' ATP During Charging = 'DuringCharging' Nominals for single chamber ICDs: Lead Noise Discrimination = 'OnWithTimeout' Lead Failure Predictor = 'On' High Rate Timeout = 'Off' VF High Rate Timeout = '0.75 min' Wavelet Rejection Rule = 'On' VF Detection Interval = 320 and SVT Minimum Cycle Length = 260 T-Wave Oversensing D

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of the Positive Predictive Value of the Investigated ICD Oversensing Algorithms
secondary_outcome.description: Endpoint: Episode classified by the device as T-wave Oversensing or 'Noise'.

clinical_study.condition: Patients With an Indication for an ICD Implantation According to the Guidelines

arm_group.description: Patients with an indication for an ICD implantation according to the guidelines treated with a Protecta™, Protecta™ XT or any equivalent following product

study_pop.textblock: Patients that satisfy the inclusion criteria and signed the informed consent

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients implanted with an Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillator (ICD) with the smart shock algorithm (Protecta™, Protecta™ XT or any equivalent following product)
- written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with life expectancy less than 24 months
- patients younger than 18 years
- pregnant or breast feeding women

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 504 patients were enrolled at 29 German sites between 09-Jun-2010 and 22-Oct-2012

group.title: ICD Patients (Single Arm Study)
group.description: Patients with an indication for an Implantable Cardioverter/Defibrillator (ICD) implantation according to the guidelines treated with a Protecta™, Protecta™ XT or any equivalent following product

group.description: Patients with an indication for an ICD implantation according to the guidelines treated with a Protecta™, Protecta™ XT or any equivalent following product

measurement_list.measurement: data has been gathered based on information stored in the device. Data on sex is not available in this data.

outcome.title: Analysis of Change of Episodes Inappropriately Treated by Shock Therapy Due to Smart Shock™ Technology.
outcome.description: Smart Shock technology is a suite of algorithms that are designed to prevent inappropriate shocks in ICD&CRT patients. Endpoints for the primary objective: Episodes with shock therapy Episodes without shock delivery due to Smart Shock™ technology Episodes classified as supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) by PR Logic Episodes classified as SVT by Wavelet Shock therapy suppressed by T-wave Discrimination Shock therapy suppressed by Lead Noise Discrimination Shock therapy suppressed by Confirmation + Episode with successful anti-tachycardia pacing (ATP) During Charging
outcome.population: The change of episodes of episodes inappropriately treated by shock due to Smart Shock™ was calculated as follow: change of episodes= (Episodes without shock therapy due to Smart Shock™)/(total number of episodes)

group.title: ICD Patients (Single Arm Study)
group.description: Patients with an indication for an ICD implantation according to the guidelines treated with a Protecta™, Protecta™ XT or any equivalent following product

measure.title: Analysis of Change of Episodes Inappropriately Treated by Shock Therapy Due to Smart Shock™ Technology.
measure.description: Smart Shock technology is a suite of algorithms that are designed to prevent inappropriate shocks in ICD&CRT patients. Endpoints for the primary objective: Episodes with shock therapy Episodes without shock delivery due to Smart Shock™ technology Episodes classified as supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) by PR Logic Episodes classified as SVT by Wavelet Shock therapy suppressed by T-wave Discrimination Shock therapy suppressed by Lead Noise Discrimination Shock therapy suppressed by Confirmation + Episode with successful anti-tachycardia pacing (ATP) During Charging
measure.population: The change of episodes of episodes inappropriately treated by shock due to Smart Shock™ was calculated as follow: change of episodes= (Episodes without shock therapy due to Smart Shock™)/(total number of episodes)
measure.units: % of episodes wo shock due to SmartShock

outcome.title: Number of Patients With All Smart Shock Algorithms Are Programmed on
outcome.description: Endpoint: Patients, in which none of the Smart Shock algorithms is programmed "OFF" during the first Follow-Up after a maximum length of 90 days and 180 days.
outcome.population: Patients with data available at 90 days

measure.title: Percentage of Patients, Without Shock Delivery Due to Smart Shock Technology

measure.units: pat. w. at least 1 shock prevented in %

outcome.title: Analysis of the Number of Patients With Primary Preventive Indication for an ICD That Develop VF Episodes.
outcome.description: Endpoint: Number of primary prevention patients with at least one ventricular fibrillation (VF) episode detected and successfully treated by the ICD
outcome.population: Of all 272 patients with primary preventive indication, only 265 patients had device data available for the Follow-Up period.

group.title: ICD Patients
group.description: Patients with an indication for an ICD implantation according to the guidelines treated with a Protecta™, Protecta™ XT or any equivalent following product

measure.title: Analysis of the Number of Patients With Primary Preventive Indication for an ICD That Develop VF Episodes.
measure.description: Endpoint: Number of primary prevention patients with at least one ventricular fibrillation (VF) episode detected and successfully treated by the ICD
measure.population: Of all 272 patients with primary preventive indication, only 265 patients had device data available for the Follow-Up period.

outcome.title: Number of Patients That Developed AT/AF
outcome.description: Endpoint: patients with >5 min atrial tachycardia/atrial fibrillation (AT/AF) in 'Daily Log' (Cardiac Compass)
outcome.population: Out of all patients analyzed (N=504), the patients with Single-Chamber-ICDs were excluded as these devices had no feature to identify AT/AF. This lead to N=367. Out of these 367 patients only 337 had Follow-Up data available whereas 30 patients only had implant data.

group.title: ICD Patients (Single Arm Study)
group.description: Patients with an indication for an ICD implantation according to the guidelines treated with a Protecta™, Protecta™ XT or any equivalent following product

measure.title: Number of Patients That Developed AT/AF
measure.description: Endpoint: patients with >5 min atrial tachycardia/atrial fibrillation (AT/AF) in 'Daily Log' (Cardiac Compass)
measure.population: Out of all patients analyzed (N=504), the patients with Single-Chamber-ICDs were excluded as these devices had no feature to identify AT/AF. This lead to N=367. Out of these 367 patients only 337 had Follow-Up data available whereas 30 patients only had implant data.

outcome.description: Endpoint: Deviation of ICD parameter programming in comparison to nominal programming at the first Follow-Up ≥ 90 days post-implant. Nominals for dual chamber ICD or cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) devices: Lead Noise Discrimination = 'OnWithTimeout' Lead Failure Predictor = 'On' PR-Logic: AfibAflutter Rejection Rule = 'On' PR-Logic: Sinus Tach Rejection Rule = 'On' PR-Logic: Other 1:1 Rejection Rule = 'On' High Rate Timeout = 'Off' VF High Rate Timeout = 'Off' Wavelet Rejection Rule = 'On' VF Detection Interval = 320 and SVT Minimum Cycle Length = 260 T-Wave Oversensing Discrimination = 'On' ATP During Charging = 'DuringCharging' Nominals for single chamber ICDs: Lead Noise Discrimination = 'OnWithTimeout' Lead Failure Predictor = 'On' High Rate Timeout = 'Off' VF High Rate Timeout = '0.75 min' Wavelet Rejection Rule = 'On' VF Detection Interval = 320 and SVT Minimum Cycle Length = 260 T-Wave Oversensing D

Nominals for dual chamber ICD or cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) devices: Lead Noise Discrimination = 'OnWithTimeout' Lead Failure Predictor = 'On' PR-Logic: AfibAflutter Rejection Rule = 'On' PR-Logic: Sinus Tach Rejection Rule = 'On' PR-Logic: Other 1:1 Rejection Rule = 'On' High Rate Timeout = 'Off' VF High Rate Timeout = 'Off' Wavelet Rejection Rule = 'On' VF Detection Interval = 320 and SVT Minimum Cycle Length = 260 T-Wave Oversensing Discrimination = 'On' ATP During Charging = 'DuringCharging' Nominals for single chamber ICDs: Lead Noise Discrimination = 'OnWithTimeout' Lead Failure Predictor = 'On' High Rate Timeout = 'Off' VF High Rate Timeout = '0.75 min' Wavelet Rejection Rule = 'On' VF Detection Interval = 320 and SVT Minimum Cycle Length = 260 T-Wave Oversensing D

outcome.title: Analysis of the Positive Predictive Value of the Investigated ICD Oversensing Algorithms
outcome.description: Endpoint: Episode classified by the device as T-wave Oversensing or 'Noise'.
outcome.population: In total, 71 episodes were detected by the device and classified as T-wave Oversensing or Noise, but only 20 had electrogram (EGM) strips available. The analysis of the positive predictive value (PPV) was performed on these 20 episodes only. The number of true positives was 20. The number of false positives was 0.

group.title: ICD Patients (Single Arm Study)
group.description: Patients with an indication for an ICD implantation according to the guidelines treated with a Protecta™, Protecta™ XT or any equivalent following product

measure.title: Analysis of the Positive Predictive Value of the Investigated ICD Oversensing Algorithms
measure.description: Endpoint: Episode classified by the device as T-wave Oversensing or 'Noise'.
measure.population: In total, 71 episodes were detected by the device and classified as T-wave Oversensing or Noise, but only 20 had electrogram (EGM) strips available. The analysis of the positive predictive value (PPV) was performed on these 20 episodes only. The number of true positives was 20. The number of false positives was 0.

reported_events.time_frame: All devices that were used in this study are market-released and were only used within their approved indication. Therefore vigilance reporting was performed in the context of Post Market Surveillance. Adverse event information was therefore not collected during this study.
reported_events.desc: All devices that were used in this study are market-released and were only used within their approved indication. Therefore vigilance reporting was performed in the context of Post Market Surveillance. Adverse event information was therefore not collected during this study.

group.title: ICD Patients (Single Arm Study)
group.description: Patients with an indication for an ICD implantation according to the guidelines treated with a Protecta™, Protecta™ XT or any equivalent following product

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The sponsor reviews publication within 3 weeks after submission of a manuscript. The sponsor can deny publication if the publication is not in accordance with the protocol, the publication would compromise business secrets or the issuing of patents or if the content of the publication is technically incorrect or may compromise other interests of the sponsor.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: No electronic case report form data available / only device data used Appropriateness of classification of Smart Shock algorithms not established; i.e. episode classification was limited to secondary endpoint 6 No source data verification
